Articles.Content:
<p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n664l7n3PU1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://bit.ly/SDvAUU"><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/401e7e3c928cb005063c330f9a9f6bfd/tumblr_inline_n664upcuN31rr2wit.png"/></a></p>

<p>While currently in beta, Astronomer’s <a href="http://bit.ly/SDvAUU"><strong>VISUAL PACK</strong></a> makes <em>Kerbal Space Program</em> a more beautiful looking experience than ever before. This <a href="http://imgur.com/a/g67Jh"><strong>ALBUM</strong></a> can say more than words can, but here are some of the updates made in the latest update:</p>

<div class="project-description">

<p><em>New HD particle textures. Multiple resolutions are provided.</em><br/><em>Added auroras to: Kerbin, Eve, Duna, Laythe, Jool, and one more rocky planet. All auroras have different colors.</em><br/><em>Added stormy clouds that move slower than clouds, high altitude clouds, and blue glow on Kerbin.</em><br/><em>Added dust storms and blue atmospheric scattering on Duna.</em><br/><em>Added bioluminescent clouds on the night side of Laythe as well as a dark blue glow.</em><br/><em>Increased contrast and added a blue aurora for Jool.</em><br/><em>Added sunlight glow / reflection for Moho + something else.</em><br/><em>Added purple glow, gas storms, and a whole new atmosphere on Eve.</em><br/><em>Added icecream dust on Minmus… yeah, that’s what it’s made of.</em><br/><em>Added glow on all rocky planets.</em><br/><em>Made shadow lip sharper depending on the size and atmosphere composition of every body.</em><br/><em>Countless other tweaks.</em></p>

<p>Download Astronomer’s Visual Pack <a href="http://bit.ly/SDvAUU"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>

</div>

<p></p>
This is definitely one of my favorite mods, just sayin. I recommend it to everyone who wants beautiful clouds and what not.

Yesh, I just hope that some kind of atmospheric effects will be included in the final version of the game

For the time being, this mod will come in handy. Thanks devs!
I've experimented with this pack and its great! I just wish I had the computer to be able to play with it without crashing too much!
As far as I know, this is just re-packaging BetterAtmospheres and Environmental Visual Enhancements. Or are there some custom changes that were made?
BA doesn't do the things this can do- just look at laythe. It's beautiful. It's basically EVE+BA+Some changes. Plus its configurable (Try the 5x cloud density IWANTMYPCINCENERATED mode!)
And a Cacteye Telescope to admire all of that eyecandy with from the comfort of Kerbin LKO!
Just to clarify a few things here: this is a mod pack for Environmental Visual Enhancements, just like Better Atmospheres... but it ain't a repackage of Better Atmospheres, not even close.
astronomers pack has better auroras than better atmospheres upcoming auroras
Maybe the problem is at my end, but I can't download the pack from curse. Is it possible to get it from somewhere else? (Amazing pack by the way!)

As far as I know, this is just re-packaging BetterAtmospheres and Environmental Visual Enhancements. Or are there some custom changes that were made?

The clouds, auroras and sandstorms are all custom textures.

EDIT: I can now tick 'be on the front of a mod page when the mod is highlighted' off my bucket list. Thanks Astronomer (again)

Edited August 17, 2014 by HatBat

As far as I know, this is just re-packaging BetterAtmospheres and Environmental Visual Enhancements. Or are there some custom changes that were made?

I don't expect anyone to read the readme, but all the things I included are made by me (except for some extras).

Sure, I didn't make the cloud textures but I edited them heavily enough. Credit goes to NASA but I'm sure you know that I didn't take the picture myself lol.

The clouds, auroras and sandstorms are all custom textures.

EDIT: I can now tick 'be on the front of a mod page when the mod is highlighted' off my bucket list. Thanks Astronomer (again)

I'm glad your bucket list is getting closer to completion.

I must note: it was the older version that got highlighted.
